protocol.name: P-GSE22274-1
text: VALUE = normalized data from combined biological replicates

protocol.name: P-GSE22274-10
text: VALUE = normalized data from combined biological replicates

protocol.name: P-GSE22274-11
protocol.text: 2-week old Col-0 wild-type plants and rpp4 mutants were infected with spores (500,000 spores / 1ml in dH2O) from 10-day old H. arabidopsidis EMWA1. Leaves were harvested at 0, 0.5, 2, 4, 6 days post-inoculation. Replicates are derived from two independent biological experiments, with no overlap in growing periods.

protocol.name: P-GSE22274-12
protocol.text: Arabidopsis seedlings were grown for 10 days at 16-18°C, 12-hr day length, 80-100% relative humidity

protocol.name: P-GSE22274-13
protocol.text: Total RNA was isolated from the frozen material using the Qiagen RNeasy kit

protocol.name: P-GSE22274-14
protocol.text: RNA probes were labelled using the GeneChip® Eukaryotic Small Sample Target Labelling Assay Version II.

protocol.name: P-GSE22274-15
protocol.text: Following fragmentation, 10 ug of cRNA were hybridized on Affymetrix ATH1 GeneChip (Santa Clara, CA, U.S.A) for 16 hours at 45C with rotation at 60rpm. .

protocol.name: P-GSE22274-16
protocol.text: Immediately following hybridization, the hybridized probe arrays undergo an automated washing and staining protocol on the GeneChip® FS450 fluidic station and are then scanned on the GeneChip® Scanner 3000 7G Plus where patterns of hybridization are detected.

protocol.name: P-GSE22274-17
protocol.text: Mixed-model ANOVA used to globally normalize all arrays and to identify differentially expressed probe sets is described in (Ref. 1 and 2).

protocol.name: P-GSE22274-18
protocol.text: Ref. 1: Brady, S. M. et al. A high-resolution root spatiotemporal map reveals dominant expression patterns. Science 318, 801-806 (2007).

protocol.name: P-GSE22274-19
protocol.text: Ref. 2: Levesque, M. P. et al. Whole-genome analysis of the SHORT-ROOT developmental pathway in Arabidopsis. PLoS biology 4, 1284-1284 (2006).
